item.title: Documentary Released About Hatsune Miku x Kodo Performance!
item.dc:creator: Missy
item.description:
Hatsune Miku is a voice from the future, and Kodo is a group bringing back sounds from the past. The two have come together for a Hatsune Miku x Kodo performance which delighted fans across the world. Who is Kodo? Kodo is a Japanese performing arts group with the goal of bringing traditional Japanese music …

The post Documentary Released About Hatsune Miku x Kodo Performance! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Hatsune Miku is a voice from the future, and Kodo is a group bringing back sounds from the past. The two have come together for a Hatsune Miku x Kodo performance which delighted fans across the world.

Who is Kodo?

Kodo is a Japanese performing arts group with the goal of bringing traditional Japanese music into the realm of modern music, and beyond. They do so mainly through the use of Japanese taiko drums. In 1981, Kodo formed, and the group has since had tours across the globe. Kodo members are passionate about their work, and what better way to showcase it than alongside Japan’s digital diva? Back in March,  Kodo and Hatsune Miku co-starred in a live collaborative performance.

For fans that missed the chance to see this, a documentary was just released on NHK WORLD which contains clips of the event. It also has other great information, interviews, and a section about VOCALOID’s rise to fame.

Entertainment Nippon 2017 — Hastune Miku x Kodo

Watch it here! https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/vod/hatsunemikukodo/20170723/

The documentary is 49 minutes long, and is entirely in English. Along with clips of the performance, there is some information about the beginnings of the group Kodo, as well as the evolution of the character of Hatsune Miku, and what it means to be a VOCALOID producer. Many shows try to cover the technical side of the VOCALOID software, but this one is different. The documentary talks about how Miku herself became popular, and lead to the rise of her fellow VOCALOIDs. It features interviews with several popular producers. They are DECO*27, livetune, MikitoP, and wowaka.

Don’t miss your chance to watch this documentary! Its availability ends after August 6th! 

The post Documentary Released About Hatsune Miku x Kodo Performance! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: “Otomate” x Kagamine Len & KAITO Collaborative Goods at Animate
item.dc:creator: Missy
item.description:
The Hatsune Miku Official Blog recently announced collaborative goods between Crypton and popular Japanese visual novel creator Otomate. The goods feature various game characters alongside Kagamine Len and KAITO, which went on sale at Animate stores in Japan on July 6th. They are also on sale at the Collaboration Store in LUCUA 1100. 初音ミクブログ更新　【その他（グッズ）】「オトメイト」×鏡音レン・KAITOコラボグッズが全国アニメイトを中心に発売！！　https://t.co/1hagCrABCA #初音ミク #オトメイト …

The post “Otomate” x Kagamine Len & KAITO Collaborative Goods at Animate appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The Hatsune Miku Official Blog recently announced collaborative goods between Crypton and popular Japanese visual novel creator Otomate. The goods feature various game characters alongside Kagamine Len and KAITO, which went on sale at Animate stores in Japan on July 6th. They are also on sale at the Collaboration Store in LUCUA 1100.

初音ミクブログ更新　【その他（グッズ）】「オトメイト」×鏡音レン・KAITOコラボグッズが全国アニメイトを中心に発売！！　https://t.co/1hagCrABCA #初音ミク #オトメイト #薄桜鬼 #カラマリ pic.twitter.com/QqAWFL6A6j

— クリプトン 初音ミク 公式 (@cfm_miku) July 3, 2017

Caption: “Hatsune Miku Official Blog Update: Otomate x Kagamine Len and KAITO collaboration goods will go on sale at Animate stores across Japan!”

The first image is for the collaboration with Otomate’s game Hakuoki, drawn by たかはしえむ (Takahashi Emu).

 

The second image is for the collaboration with Collar x Malice, drawn by Yume no Uchi (夢ノ内).

Goods for Sale

Here are the goods that are on sale at Animate!

Clear File Folders (2 types) – ¥350 JPY each (about $3.50 USD)

 

Acrylic Keychains (4 types) – ¥650 JPY each (about $6.50 USD)

 

Can Badges (4 types) – ¥500 JPY each (about $5.00 USD)

 

Be sure to catch these items while you can! Also, stay tuned to VNN, because we will update should any further details get revealed!

Source

http://blog.piapro.net/2017/07/c1707031-1.html

The post “Otomate” x Kagamine Len & KAITO Collaborative Goods at Animate appeared first on VNN.

item.title: AHS VOCALOIDs to be Sold in Germany with German V4 Editor!
item.dc:creator: Missy
item.description:
Guten Tag! Fans of AHS VOCALOIDs may know that, in the past, some of their voice banks were sold at AnimeFanShop.de in Germany. (These guys are also in charge of Anime Messe Berlin.) However, some V4 updates such as Tohoku Zunko and Macne Nana were never for sale on the site. For fans wondering why, …

The post AHS VOCALOIDs to be Sold in Germany with German V4 Editor! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Guten Tag! Fans of AHS VOCALOIDs may know that, in the past, some of their voice banks were sold at AnimeFanShop.de in Germany. (These guys are also in charge of Anime Messe Berlin.) However, some V4 updates such as Tohoku Zunko and Macne Nana were never for sale on the site. For fans wondering why, we have good news!

Concert Announcement

During the Anime Messe Berlin concert on Saturday, Chihiro Ishiguro (who also performed at the concert) announced that AHS will soon be selling their VOCALOID4 voice banks in Germany. They will come complete with a German interface of the V4 Editor. Look for them at www.vocala.de when they go on sale!

Some may be familiar with the company this page leads to, Englemann Software GmbH. It’s a German business partner of AHS who distributes Yuzuki Yukari V3 and translated her Tiny V3 Editor into German. In fact, clicking on the vocala.de link leads to the page selling Yukari with the German Tiny V3. Given this information, it is likely Englemann will also be distributing the German V4 Editor and voice banks from AHS.

VOCALOID4 voice banks are going to be available soon in Germany! The interface is in German! – http://www.vocala.de/

 

Further Details

After the concert announcement, AHS made this post on their website. It says that the VOCALOIDs set for sale on the website are Yuzuki Yukari, Tohoku Zunko, Kaai Yuki, Hiyama Kiyoteru, Nekomura Iroha, SF-A2 Miki, and Macne Nana. It also includes details about their 3D animation tool, Charamin Studio, which will be given a German interface along with the V4 Editor. Charamin will be for sale on their site and there will also be a patch to allow pre-existing users to switch to German.

These will go on sale sometime “after June” according to AHS, but no set date has been given yet. For those interested, keep your eyes peeled on AHS’ website and social media, and we’ll be sure to report any updates when they arise. Bis bald!

Sources

AHS News Feed

The post AHS VOCALOIDs to be Sold in Germany with German V4 Editor! appeared first on VNN.
